thread.title: Healthy Thanksgiving Recipes Your Friends Will Love
thread.title_full: Healthy Thanksgiving Recipes Your Friends Will Love

author: Corinne Schmitt
title: Healthy Thanksgiving Recipes Your Friends Will Love
text:
Thanksgiving is the perfect time to gather around the table with loved ones and savor the flavors of the season. But enjoying a festive meal doesn’t have to mean sacrificing your health.
Whether you’re looking to lighten up classic favorites or add a fresh twist to your table, these healthy Thanksgiving recipes have you covered.
Healthy Turkey Tetrazzini
This cozy turkey tetrazzini turns Thanksgiving turkey into a light and creamy comforting dish. It’s a tasty way to offer a healthier main dish for your Thanksgiving feast.
Sugar-Free Low Carb Pumpkin Pie
With its velvety, spiced pumpkin filling, this no-bake, low carb pie offers all the warm, autumn flavors of Thanksgiving, without the sugar. Use this recipe for a guilt-free fall treat.
Butternut Squash and Kale Stuffing
Roasted butternut squash and tender kale come together in this wholesome, rustic stuffing. It’s a vibrant and fresh alternative to traditional bread-based stuffings.
Air Fryer Butternut Squash Fries
These golden butternut squash fries are crisp on the outside and sweetly soft inside. The air-fryer makes this an easy and light side dish that pairs perfectly with Thanksgiving flavors.
Healthier Stovetop Mac and Cheese
This creamy stovetop mac and cheese uses greek yogurt to cut back on calories without sacrificing any flavor. It’s a warm, satisfying dish without the heavy feeling that kids and adults will love in your Thanksgiving spread.
Sugar Snap Pea Casserole
A refreshing fall twist on a Thanksgiving classic, this casserole features crisp, vibrant sugar snap peas in a creamy sauce. A bright and light side for your holiday spread.
Healthy Mashed Potatoes
These mashed potatoes are fluffy and light, with Greek yogurt and broth giving them a creamy texture without the usual richness. These are a great way to make a classic Thanksgiving side without the extra calories.
Healthy Green Bean Casserole
A Thanksgiving staple with a healthier twist, this gluten-free green bean casserole uses green beans and a homemade mushroom sauce for a nutritious and delicious holiday side.
Roasted Carrots With A Ginger Yogurt Sauce And Pepitas
Sweet roasted carrots are drizzled with a tangy ginger yogurt sauce and sprinkled with crunchy pepitas in this recipe. This colorful side bursts with fall flavor and adds a colorful addition to your Thanksgiving feast.
Healthy Cranberry Sauce With Cider And Vanilla
This spiced cranberry sauce, with hints of cinnamon and vanilla perfectly captures the essence of fall. It’s a healthy, tangy, and sweet complement to any Thanksgiving feast.

Meet Corinne
Hi! I’m Corinne, a busy mom of four and the creator of Wondermom Wannabe. I’ve spent years helping moms like you simplify life with quick meal solutions and easy family tips. Wondermom Wannabe started as a place to share practical tips for home and family life, and it’s grown into a resource where you can find inspiration to make every day a little easier.
